desc: The Soul of Stuff: Arts, Culture, and Ethics ­ Artifacts, dolls, souls, trash. This team­ taught course combines perspectives from history, literature, and management to ask why do we collect stuff? Why does stuff matter? Does it possess its own soul, or does culture endow it with meaning? Why does some stuff remain valuable while much becomes garbage? Explore these questions and others through active learning practices such as making artifacts, collecting them for a museum, and reflecting through analytical and creative writing opportunities.
name: Research: Arts, Culture, and Ethics
notes: Full title: Research: The Soul of Stuff: Arts, Culture, and Ethics. Registration by permission of instructor. This is one of three linked 396 courses (ENGL, HIST, MGMT).

Full title: Research: The Soul of Stuff: Arts, Culture, and Ethics. Prereq: Art 240 (taken during Interim). Registration by permission of instructor. This is one of three linked 396 courses (ENGL, HIST, MGMT). WRI pending approval.

revisions.desc: This course provides a comprehensive research opportunity, including an introduction to relevant background material, technical instruction, identification of a meaningful project, and data collection. The topic is determined by the faculty member in charge of the course and may relate to his/her research interests. Offered based on department decision. May be offered as a 1.00 credit course or .50 credit course. Prerequisite: determined by individual instructor.

title: Directed Undergraduate Research
